Class Client_Settings ¶

Synopsis

Functions
client.settings.addAir()

Adds a space in the ui
client.settings.addInfo()

Adds text in the ui, you can change the content of the variable and the ui will display the changes
client.settings.addBool()

Adds a toggle switch in the ui
client.settings.addKeybind()

Adds a keybind for the user to set in the ui
client.settings.addInt()

Adds a slider in the ui
client.settings.addFloat()

Adds a slider in the ui
client.settings.addColor()

Adds a color for the user to change in the ui
client.settings.addFunction()

Adds a button in the ui
client.settings.send()

Sends setting value from the script to the client If you change one of the settings yourself it may not apply, this will make it apply
client.settings.send()

Sends setting value from the script to the client If you change one of the settings yourself it may not apply, this will make it apply
client.settings.reload()

Gets the latest settings from the client Close to useless
client.settings.addAir(Space) ¶

Adds a space in the ui

client.settings.addInfo(variableName) ¶

Adds text in the ui, you can change the content of the variable and the ui will display the changes

client.settings.addBool(name, variableName) ¶

Adds a toggle switch in the ui

client.settings.addKeybind(name, variableName) ¶

Adds a keybind for the user to set in the ui

client.settings.addInt(name, variableName, minimum, maximum) ¶

Adds a slider in the ui

client.settings.addFloat(name, variableName, minimum, maximum) ¶

Adds a slider in the ui

client.settings.addColor(name, variableName) ¶

Adds a color for the user to change in the ui

client.settings.addFunction(name, variableName, buttonName) ¶

Adds a button in the ui

client.settings.send(invisbleSettingsOnly) ¶

Sends setting value from the script to the client If you change one of the settings yourself it may not apply, this will make it apply

client.settings.send() ¶

Sends setting value from the script to the client If you change one of the settings yourself it may not apply, this will make it apply

client.settings.reload() ¶

Gets the latest settings from the client Close to useless
